titles.title: California Five Mile Regional Learning Center Transfer Act
California Five Mile Regional Learning Center Transfer Act
California Five Mile Regional Learning Center Transfer Act
California Five Mile Regional Learning Center Transfer Act

To provide for the conveyance of Forest Service facilities and lands comprising the Five Mile Regional Learning Center in the State of California to the Clovis Unified School District, to authorize a new special use permit regarding the continued use of unconveyed lands comprising the Center, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health Discharged.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-574.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 344.

action.text: Mrs. Cubin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3401.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 678.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 7/22/2002--Passed House amended. California Five Mile Regional Learning Center Transfer Act - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to: (1) convey to the Clovis Unified School District of California a specified parcel of National Forest System (NFS) land which has been utilized as the Five Mile Regional Learning Center by such school district since 1989 pursuant to a special use permit to provide natural resource conservation education to California youth; and (2) negotiate with the school district to enter into a new permit for the approximately 100 acres of NFS land that the school district is using pursuant to the present permit but that is not included in such conveyance.States that the conveyance shall be for a nominal cost and shall not include the transfer of mineral rights.
